results.title: Two worlds: one me
results.creator_credit: Elinor Moshe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Born in Israel during the Gulf War but eventually moving to Australia, Elinor Moshe finds herself caught between two countries, cultures and traditions.

results.title: H.U.R.G. for ZX Spectrum 48K
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer program. Cassette, manual, cardboard cassette case and plastic cassette tray.
results.brief_description:
“H.U.R.G., High-Level User-Friendly Real-Time Games Designer”, is a program that enables you to create games. It is a menu driven utility designed to assist in creating games for the ZX Spectrum 48K and can be used by those with little or no knowledge of programming. For example, by using the ‘Edit Game’ menu option, the player can select actions such as creating a title page or specifying playing conditions via sub-menus. Utilities like these opened the possibilities for using home computers, by making programming accessible to anyone who was interested. Games created with “H.U.R.G.” are not stand-alone; they still require the engine to run.

“H.U.R.G.” came with three demo games that were created within the engine: ‘Manic Koala’, ‘Egg Pack’ and ‘Ms. Hortense’. Melbourne House ran competitions to encourage people to use “H.U.R.G.” in games design, with cash prizes for the best games created on the software.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/h-u-r-g-high-level-user-friendly-real-time-game-designer/

Last accessed: 5/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software. Published in 1984 by Melbourne House.

results.title: My first year
results.creator_credit: Louise Bryant, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Louise shares her experiences and the three most important lessons she learnt in her first year as a secondary teacher. These are the things they don’t teach you at uni; survival, rewards and pleasant surprises.

results.title: Gia mas (About us)
results.creator_credit: Parthena Savvidou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After her mother left, Parthena Savvidou and her father fled to Greece to live with Parthena’s grandparents for six years before their eventual return to Australia. This story is about Parthena’s memories of life in Greece and her special relationship with her father. A thank you from a daughter to her father.

results.title: Yodit and I
results.creator_credit: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tale of heroic acts of a mother’s quest to return her son safe and sound from the battlefields of East Africa in 1896. This inspiring story of Yodit, now half legend, stays alive as it is passed down from one generation to the next.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Western Stories : Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.
results.title_for_label: Western stories: expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: I am Sophie hear me rawr!!...meow
results.creator_credit: Sophie Obradovic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sophie Obradovic and her brother Nathan are a dynamic duo! Obradovic talks about her strong connection to her family and friends, her ethnic identity and being an ‘emo’.

results.title: Two songs by Dougie Young. Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Franco Rosso, Michael Buckley, John Bird, Arts Council of Great Britain and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Two Songs by Dougie Young (Melb., 1979, 7 min.): Aboriginal singer Dougie Young sings two of his songs as the basis of an animated film about aboriginal issues. “Dread Beat and Blood” (U.K., 1979, 47 min.): A unique combination of poetry, music and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson.
results.title_for_label: Two songs by Dougie Young. Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Rosso, Michael Buckley, John Bird, Arts Council of Great Britain and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
